titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: John Stevens was a Charleston, South Carolina, businessman. His daughter, Mary Ann Elizabeth Stevens, married George Cogdell. Their son was Richard Walpole Cogdell (1787-1866). He had several children by his African-American mistress, Sarah Sanders (d. 1850). In the 1850s, Cogdell arranged for the Sanderses to move to Philadelphia. One of Richard and Sarah's daughters was Julia Sanders, who married Edward Y. Venning. Their daughter was Miranda Cogdell Venning (1862-1900), the first African-American graduate of Philadelphia's Girlsâ€™ Normal School (1882) and principal of the Joseph E. Hill School.

scopecontent.p: This is a miscellaneous collection of papers related to the Cogdell, Venning, Sanders, and Stevens families. Stevens family materials include two letter books (1768-1772) dealing largely with business matters in the West Indies and England, and a commonplace book of Mary Ann Elizabeth Stevens. The Cogdell family materials include estate papers, deeds, indentures, and wills; and correspondence, receipt books, and scrapbooks of R.W. Cogdell. Venning family materials include a family bible, baptismal certificates, and genealogical material; Declaration of Substitute for Edward Y. Venning (1863); and a book of quotes presented to Miranda Venning by William Carl Bolivar. Other families represented in the collection are the Holdens, Chews, Bowies, and Capps. The collection also includes wedding invitations and funeral announcements, scrapbooks, programs, church bulletins, broadsides, and newspaper clippings, including some of W. Carl Bolivar's column "Pencil Pusher Points," which was published in the Philadelphia Tribune.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Library Company of Philadelphia: Photograph Album Collection, Stevens, Cogdell, Sanders, and Venning families, two albums.
